meanings.definition: a person who sells or delivers newspapers
meanings.sent1: The newsies on the corner were shouting out the headlines.
meanings.sent2: The newsies gathered at the newsstand every morning to pick up their papers.
meanings.sent3: The newsies had a race to see who could deliver the papers the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The newsies were like a flock of birds, spreading news throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The newsies wore caps and carried bags full of newspapers.

meanings.sent1: The newsies worked together to cover different areas of the city.
meanings.sent2: Every evening, the newsies would meet up to count their earnings.
meanings.sent3: The newsies formed a club where they shared tips on selling newspapers.
meanings.sent4: The newsies were a lively bunch, always chatting and laughing.
meanings.sent5: The newsies set up a competition to see who could sell the most papers in a week.

meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of newspaper sellers
meanings.sent1: The newsies strike was all over the headlines.
meanings.sent2: She wore a newsies cap to show her love for newspapers.
meanings.sent3: The newsies convention had newspaper-themed decorations everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His newsies charm won over the customers every time.
meanings.sent5: The newsies culture was filled with stories of early mornings and hard work.
